item.title: How to use the Clojure REBL with Leiningen, Cider and Emacs
item.description: Note: This set of instructions only work on Clojure 1.10+, Lein 2.9+ and JDK 11+. Also, REBL requires a license for commercial use. I didn’t find a handy reference to getting started with REBL if your primary workflow is Leiningen/nrepl, so here is the series of things I had to do to get the REBL up and running for myself. Download the REBL jar from Cognitect. Use lein-localrepo to install the REBL jar to your m2.

item.title: Problems in my brand new System76 Oryx Pro laptop
item.description: Important Note I’m enjoying using a Linux laptop after years of development on the Macbook, and this post is more a list of issues I personally faced on moving to Linux after 7 years of development on the Macbook. I’d written a similar thing when I’d moved to the Macbook for the first time. Hopefully, this will help someone else moving to this particular laptop. This is not a “look, linux sux” post.

item.title: Why I Quit StumpWM
item.description: After using StumpWM for nearly a year, I’m finally quitting and moving back to Gnome. I came to love StumpWM’s minimalistic approach, and this isn’t an easy decision. So why am I doing it?
